Reviews.Title: “Not quite as reviewed.”
Reviews.Author: CherylNS
Reviews.Content: Fellow reviewers had raved about the hotel which is why we selected it . . . and there are good things. Great location - right in the heart of things - close to the tram and to many sites and shops. Friendly staff, great terrace for the yummy breakfast's that are served (we also ate dinner there one evening which was quite good). However this is where the compliments end. I had a room with 2 twin bed. I chose one of the bed sto sleep in and when I pulled back the crisply ironed top cover, it was obvious that the bed had not been changed as it was covered with black hairs. Not what you want to find in a bed you are about to sleep in. Someone came to the room to change it, but obviously had never changed a bed before. Dropped the clean sheet on top of the dirty sheet . . . I slept that night in the other bed and changed rooms the next day. Rooms are very small and you can hardly turn around in the bathroom - so adequate, but not that comfortable overall.

Reviews.Title: “Ambassador Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JillDV8
Reviews.Content: Ideally located across the road from the Blue Mosque in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul, this modern, comfortable hotel suited us perfectly. A short walk from the Grand Bazaar and right on the tram line to other attractions, the hotel is situated in a street full of wonderful restaurants. Rooms were small but comfortable and bathrooms modern. Staff friendly and the views from the breakfast room were superb. Value for money.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Port Washington, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: Paul J
Reviews.Content: Just got here today 4/13, but so happy with our choice. Location is amazing, room great, cant go wrong with a stay here. Looking forward to our next two days here. Kudos to the great staff also.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel opposite blue mosque”
Reviews.Author: CHRISTOS_GR60
Reviews.Content: nice hotel very very central.beautiful new rooms. excellent bathrooms and very clean. size of rooms bit small. personal very helpful breakfast room on top floor with best view from bosporus and blue mosque very nice and good quality foods very polite the lady in breakfastroom prices affordable i was very satisfied

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: sabbab_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from the hotel! Location wise it is bang in the middle of Sultan Ahmet so all major attractions i.e. Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar and Topkapi is within walking distance. The family room for 4 people is just next to the restaurant/bar/terrace so it was ideal for us as we could go out for a cigarette and get night view of entire sultan Ahmet area from our roof top. I must say, the breakfast is a must try as it indeed is phenomenal and the amount served should get you going for until 4PM. Highly recommended for families, groups and students.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: jwillner
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - 100 m. to Blue Mosque and Sophia Hague. 30 m. to trolley stop. Staff is great - efficient, friendly, helpful. Fabulous. And the view for breakfast is stupendous - Blue Mosque to the water.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: theloubifarang
Reviews.Content: Located at the heart of Sultanahmet, close to the blue mosquee, hagia sofia, the grand bazaar, the topkapi palace, this hotel makes for a pleasant stay in Istanbul. The tram stationat the bottom of the hotel is the best way to visit galata district and enjoy a nice evening at the roof top bar. What a great breakfast/afternoon beer on the roof top terrace ! Entire staff was really kind and friendly. Definitely, a great hotel to visit an amazing Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: alexcub
Reviews.Content: This little gem of a hotel situated right in the heart of Sultanahmet right accross the street from the Hippodrome makes for a perfect stay in Istanbul. All major points of interest are within walking distance. Staff is extremely friendly and professional and eager to assist. The breakfast on the roof top terrace is fine with an excellent view. I would highly recommend this hotel for any type of stay. Excellent deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great People”
Reviews.Author: Ryan F
Reviews.Content: The Ambassador Hotel was an all-together wonderful way to experience the Golden Horn. Situated in the heart of the major attractions, the entrance is off a picturesque old-world side street. The tram stop is literally a block away which allows one to get around easily and cheaply. The rooftop breakfasts provide breathtaking views of the Hagia Sophia, the Sultanahmet, and the Bosphorus. Even more brilliant than the location was the staff. Sueda, the manager, was exuberant, helpful, and just a joy to be around. We were given directions several times to different parts of the city and they were always spot-on. We stayed for 5 nights and the staff let us borrow a converter for our entire time there. No matter what time of day or night, the front desk was always looking to serve us with chai and conversation or board games in the bar area. I would definitely go back to the Ambassador Hotel because they treated us very well...and the shower pressure was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A cosy small hotel to stay for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: loskokosos
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for a long weekend stay in Istanbul. Rooms are clean and cosy, but a little bit small, due you stay in a very very city centre. Breakfast is fine and the view from the breakfast room and terrace early in the morning is very nice. The hotel is close to the main tourist attractions and to the Blue Mosque and Haia Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: George L
Reviews.Content: The Ambassador is a nice little hotel with a Mom & Pop feel, but with great professional service. The location is fantastic...with in steps to the Tram and very close to all the tourist attractions/landmarks. The morning breakfast was pretty good with a good selection. I would definitely stay here again if I were to stay in this area. Negative: My only gripe is the shower head in the standard rooms are quite low. I'm not a tall person (5'10), but even I was bumping my head into it. Also, since businesses/buildings are built very close to one another, the mornings can be a little noisy with other businesses getting ready for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Position + View + Good Staff = Right Choice”
Reviews.Author: RetiredWazza
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel for a 1st visit to Istanbul or a subsequent visit that seeks to be part of the history, the food, the ambience of Istanbul. On one side the unbelievably beautiful view of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorous, on the other sides the views of the life of old Istanbul - the hammam, the restaurants, the laneways; and all of these within easy walking. Then there is thye staff - we loved the friendliness of waiters, Sezgin & Cafer, and the mothering at breakfast of Erika. This place was special from the freshness of the mezzes at Breakfast through to the complimentary afternoon teas (a chance to share the day with other tourists). We like boutique, serviced focussed accommodation - the Ambassador is such and allowed us to feel very special on our 1st trip to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS FIND IN HEART OF OLD CITY OF ISTANBUL!”
Reviews.Author: carolesuerose
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location! Reasonable Price! Clean! Terrific Staff! Can't say enough about this surprise we had when we visited last week. Took the hotel off the Internet and will recommend to everyone who is going there. Lovely Rooftop with views of Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, etc where you have a fabulous breakfast plus other meals if desired. Walk three minutes to the Mosque and Sofia plus short stroll to Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. Nuray greeted us as we arrived and was enormously helpful throughout our visit. Greeted with complimentary fruit plus bottle of wine when we entered our room. If going to Istanbul, this would be the perfect spot to make your visit a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ewiart
Reviews.Content: It is the perfect location, great price, stuff is very friendly, very nice breakfast, rooms very clean and the shower is really good!!! Absolutely nothing to complain

Reviews.Title: “hÄ±ghly recommendable”
Reviews.Author: WÄ±lhelmÄ±ne s
Reviews.Content: ThÄ±s hotel Ä±s based Ä±n the old centre of Istanbul. You can reach all the most Ä±mportant sÄ±ghts by walkÄ±ng dÄ±stance. Grand basar Ä±s just round the corner. The tramway leaves just 3 mÄ±nutes from the hotel. The staff Ä±s very frÄ±endly and extremely helpful. Any questÄ±on wÄ±ll be answered Ä±mmedÄ±ately and they gÄ±ve you helpful advÄ±ces where to go and what to see. We were heartÄ±ly welcomed by Mr. FerdÄ± and he gave us the feelÄ±ng to belong to a bÄ±g famÄ±ly. Mr. Cafer mÄ±xes you wonderful drÄ±nks and Ä±s a bÄ±g help to get around Ä±n Istanbul. Just ask hÄ±m. Worth mentÄ±onÄ±ng Ä±s as well the hamam and the relaxÄ±ng atmosphere. Breakfast Ä±s served on the top floor and terrace the vÄ±ew to the HagÄ±a SophÄ±a and the Sultan Ahmed Mosque Ä±s breathtakÄ±ng and overwhelmÄ±ng. A glass of wÄ±ne Ä±n the evenÄ±ng on that terrace gÄ±ves you the feelÄ±ng of beÄ±ng Ä±n 1001 nÄ±ghts. The hotelroom Ä±s very clean as well as the food Ä±s really good. The vÄ±ew from your hotel rooms are not good sÄ±nce the hotel Ä±s sÄ±tuated Ä±n a small street surrounded by other buÄ±ldÄ±ngs, however, the terrace makes Ä±t up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Mike336
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times at The Ambassador Hotel in Istanbul and have enjoyed my stay. It is well situated for visiting the historical parts of the city with very good transportion facilities. The staff are very friendly and are very helpful. The assitant mananger Ms. Sueda has shown excellent customer service and so have all her staff. I will be returning again on occassion as I frequently visit Istanbul. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sevtap p
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ambassador was an perfect choice ..our stay was a memorable one and that is because of the pleasant attitude of staff specially (Ms. Suada if I am not mistaken she is The Hotel Manager) and the convenient location, excellent buffet...we recommend it highly to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Yesim S
Reviews.Content: This is a small but perfectly formed boutique hotel. The staff are helpful, knowledgeable and friendly, especially the manageress Sue, she has a good sense of humour, very funny! The room was very clean and comfortable with a hair drier, the breakfast was very good with lots to choose from, cooked to order eggs, cereals, different chesees, jams, pastries etc. The location is excellent, main attractions are all within walking distance, Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque. You could easily walk to Eminonu to take the ferry for the Bosphorus tour, if the weather is good, climb to the castle at the top of the hill when you stop for lunch, the view is to die for! All in all, this is a great stopping point for a city break in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “location is perfect and staff very helpfull,excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Sharon F
Reviews.Content: The hotel was above of our expectation. excellent service and staff was very helpfull and friendly, I enjoyed so much my holiday and i would highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - clean & helpful staff, Mr. Ferdi”
Reviews.Author: Fapoon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just located a few minutes from the main sight-seeing points so we basically walked to most of the sights within the old town and it's just 2 minutes from the tram station, so location wise it was perfect. The room itself was very simple but clean and equipped with hairdryer, so it was alright. The best about this hotel is probably the view of it's rooftop restaurant where you get to look over the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofya during breakfast. Breakfast was pretty good too as they have a toaster for making hot toast and they have someone there to cook different kinds of egg for you at the spot, so that was really good for a simple hotel like this. They had a new staff at reception there, Ferdi. And we were lucky yo have checked in with him as he was extremely helpful and gave us a lot of information about the city as well as even some history of Istanbul! We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel however I heard the rooms are like double priced during summer so really hope I'd still get to stay here next time I visit Istanbul which is very likely going to be some other warmer season as heavy snow at -2 degrees really wasn't the best time to visit some of the outdoor sites.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay Ambassador Again”
Reviews.Author: valeria t
Reviews.Content: Stayed Ambassador with my wife and kids and had a confortable stay 4 minutes walk from the Sultanahmed and the Grand Bazaar. 3mins walk from the Sultanahmet Tram station Rooms are confortable and Clean , Hotel front desk staff are welcoming and efficient, It's a nice place to stay if you need a quite and nice hotel to rest from the day touring. Airport tarnsfer and restaurant and tours book service is quite useful and the receptionist kindly arranged for additionnal services. Bunyamin was exceptional in his Leveel of service and care to Their guests.Ben took the trouble to introduce all the sights and attractions near the hotel and recommended those that were worth going

Reviews.Title: “â€œwonderful Location - wonderful staff!â€�”
Reviews.Author: giuseppe d
Reviews.Content: Great Welcoming Ambassador Hotel.. Especially when We arrived early evening. The room is nicely decorated, simple but Cosy , everything was in room to feel Comportable. Every day a nice buffet breakfast with lovely Marmara sea view in the top breakfast room. The receptinon are there all the time and very helpfull on guiding around Old and modern city, book budget restaurants, showing nice area to visit,just like great Concierge in Luxury's hotel. the Situation is great and safe. I must give credit to Mr Bunyamin and miss Nouray for there hospitality Tesekkur alot for everything guys. We would definitely stay at Ambasasador Hotel again on our next trip for Istanbull.

Reviews.Title: “â€œ Boutique hotel with friendly stafflâ€�”
Reviews.Author: valeria C
Reviews.Content: Ambassador hotel was an absolute treasure in the heart of SultanAhmet., thanks to its staff. . Front desk was incredibly warm and friendly - they made my travel companions and I feel like a family When e checked in, staff kept feeding us nice welcome drink - Turkish Delight on arrival Triple room was small but clean , Bunyamin upgraded us no charge to a family room, and assisted us with some lost luggage with lots of complimentary stuff, the breakfast is very good and varied, the restaurant deserves a visit. We stayed Ambassador for 5 days with my family for holidays and we never found anything wrong. We would most strongly recommend Ambassador hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “â€œ Ambassador Brilliant Sultanahmet Hotelâ€�”
Reviews.Author: malay221hamid
Reviews.Content: Me and my family at the Ambassador for 4 nights in Late December. Ambassador is in a busy location but in the heart of the old city great for all the shopping and sight seeing. Great position all major sights are a 10 minute walk and it is a 1 minute walk to the Sultanahmet tram . They offer a free pick up service from the airport The rooms are spotlessly clean and quiet, even if you face the front of hotel . While a bit small, I found the size to be average or slightly better than average to most Istanbul Hotels.. , breakfasts are not exciting all there but nothing out of the ordinary, But breakfast staff are very attentive. Reception is amazing and make you feel welcome from the early morning . Bunyamin and Moustafa are a pleasure to speak with, and the lady at the front desk(Nouray ) are as sweet as can be. They are was young and energetic. making budget tour reservations and arranging Taxi Sahabe Eyyup El Ensari Mosgue and Kabir visit etc Night before leaving Beunyamin sent up a apple cayh , Turkish delight and Apple tea it was a nice touch,you will not be disappointed Ambassador Hotel Whenever I return to Turkey , I will stay Ambassador .

Reviews.Title: “Charming staff , Excellent Location and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mina j
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights recently and I would recommend Ambassador hotel. Its very well priced for the quality of rooms, amenities and awesome Location is convenient for Covered Grand Bazaar and Santa Sophia..... Sultanahmet tram stop also very close. Reception Benyamun is amazing at his jwork , handsome guy to deal with. I applaud her for his patience and friendly nature. Many a hotel personnel could learn from his advice. Service, hospitality , location, room size, free apple tea .. Everything was just I expected them to be.... Marvellous View on terrace to enjoy the real Istanbul!.. Buffet breakfast was really Turkish and tasty. overall, good experience . I would recommend Ambassador hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “home from home”
Reviews.Author: Dekoks
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with friendly, helpful and knowledgable staff that go out of their way to make your stay pleasant. The location of the hotel is perfect for families, with easy access to public transportation. (Sultanamhet) Walking distance from the top 10 list for Istanbul. Great pastry shop, Hafiz Mostafa around the corner. Teoman is the best waiter! Adonin restaurant outside the hotel, good prices and good traditional Turkish food. (Avoid Sura restaurant up the street, service and food not good) The Han near Topkapi palace is a great traditional eatery. Purchase the museum card instead of individual passes for the museums. The Ambassador Hotel 1. remember to arranged a pick-up from the airport 2. the whole hotel is light, airy, clean, modern decor 3. wonderful terrace overlooking the blue mosque and aroundings 4. tea time at 3pm is lovely 5. child friendly! 6. plenty of hot water, high pressure. 7. ample supply of bathroom amenities 8. staff very friendly, accommodating and caring 9. safe clean neighbourhood 10. wi-fi free and good speed! We will definately return to this hotel, because a week in Istanbul was not enough. beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Early Christmas stay Istanbul Gem hotel friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: sanna32
Reviews.Content: We stayed for fews nights in a suit room on the firts floor. Our room was quite small with tiny jakuzzi to the street but nice and well maintained . Breakfast was good,nice and well maintained . The location is excellent but on weekend night pretty noisy , and receptionist very helpful, smiling nice touch :Bunyamin front desk was outstanding, and the barmen Tahour , and Miss Noureay , Guest Relations could not have been more helpful and friendly . bottled wine was free. bed was soft Location was pretty good, very close to a busy Blue Mosgue Santa Sophia Topkapi Ottoman Palace , ATMs, and Restaurants I would come Ambassador again, it's good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Facility ,l ocation and Staff were all excellent!”
Reviews.Author: RENARDE D
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ambassadorl is located in Istanbul old city and very close to most of the historical places in this area. It is just few minutes walk to Hagia Sophia and also very close to Topkapi Palac. The rooms are not big but fairly comfortable and very clean. The hotel receptionist are very friendly and helpful. Open breakfast buffet is good which is served on the top floor with nice panaroma.Higly recommend Ambassador to the business Visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest place to go..”
Reviews.Author: Tammye44
Reviews.Content: As upon our arrival to Istanbul,We were a bit over whelmed as to where to stay.We arrived at the Ambassador Hotel, a very elegant and sophisticated place, we decided to stay there.My son and I being from Alabama, U.S had no clue as to where to go or what places to tour.As we entered the front desk clerk greeted us.I was shocked because he was a pleasure and even spoke a bit of english .He made our stay very welcomed.Bunyamin even gave us tourist information and provided us with what we needed to enjoy our first trip to another country.The breakfast and overall experience was awesome. The tea Bunyamin offered my son was greatly appreciated and very welcomed. Our overall stay was the best we ever had Thanks to Bunyamin for helping us..

Reviews.Title: “â€œcant find a more convenient hotel in Sultanahmetâ€�”
Reviews.Author: gerard_lovers
Reviews.Content: Best things not far away Ambassador location for Hagia Sophia Topkapi Palace Blue Mosgue and Ibrahim Pasha Museum walking distance .Junior suite not very large but ok breakfast also Ok. Free welcome drink was a nice touch front desk staff helpfull and polite

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Bunyamin and other staff”
Reviews.Author: hassan295424
Reviews.Content: We had visited Turkey in November and were a large family with our Europa vocation, unfortunately we had to change the hotel at the nth hour because we had a celebrity amidst us and he had a preference. But i continued staying here along with a few from my family . We must say the rooms are lovely and unexpected ! Satff most of all- the front desk Bunyamin is such a nice friendly receptionist . He really helped us out and did everything possible to help me taxi with the pressure i was under at the time! He was knowledgeable, freindly ,helpfull, generous and kind. That was the first glimpse i had of the lovely people of Istanbul and We had such a nice time in this beautiful city. We did enjoyed our vacation and We will definitely be back Ambassador! tH

Reviews.Title: “Smart choice for your days in old town”
Reviews.Author: Adam M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend with a friend. As a lover of Starwoods/Westins/W Hotels, I was a little nervous about staying at a small local joint, but a trusted friend's recommendation (who travels far more than me) pushed me to give this place a try. I was not disappointed. My rating of excellent is based on the following strengths: Service: Very friendly staff, extremely helpful about the area and things tourists should know about. Afternoon and evening complimentary tea service (with sweets) is provided in the lobby, and a great way to relax after a day of sightseeing in Sultanahmet. Value: A rate of 90 euros per night for a Double room (which included a single and King bed), and free breakfast for both me and my friend on the rooftop terrace earns an excellent rating for Value. The view was nonexistent (of an air conditioner and the building next door) but the location made up for it. On the plus side, my no view first floor room shielded me from the calls to prayer, which I never heard nor woke up from in my room. Breakfast is substantial - juices (cherry, peach), coffee, breads, cereals, cheese, bread olives, meats, salads, all with a great view of Blue Mosque. The hotel cat may pay you a visit on the windowsill to ask for some of your turkey. You'll also get to meet and overhear interesting conversation from other smart travelers who choose this location. Location: Walking distance to everything: Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Cistern, Bazaars. If you dont have a view, just step outside and zig zag your way through the charming alleys and side streets lined with cafes for less than a minute, and you are in view of the best of old town. Rooms and bed are nothing to write home about, but they were clean. If you are like me and need a bit of luxury in your trip, stay here for a few days as you explore old town, then move on to your favorite higher end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: NKopp
Reviews.Content: We selected the Ambassador Hotel in Istanbul on the recommendation of a friend and we were not disappointed. The hotel is very well located for all the major sites. We walked everywhere and never used the bus or tram! From the time we were picked up at the airport (included in the price) our experience with the Ambassador was all positive. We were introduced to apple tea by Bunyamin Ozkaplan at reception and he was immediately like a long lost friend. He is very knowledgeable about the city, eager to guide and help you and has a great sense of humour!. He booked some our outings and we got the best seats in the venue. When we returned at the end of the day we were always greeted with very courteous staff and the offer of tea. The roof terrace restaurant has a good breakfast which caters for vegetarians as well and is ideal when you want to relax and have a quiet dinner. We both felt this was probably one of our best holidays ever and the Ambassador and it's staff contributed in large measure in making this vacation a success.

Reviews.Title: “â€œA real Gem !â€�”
Reviews.Author: marta g
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ambassador hotels during October 2011 and I was travelling alone as a single Woman . It was a pleasure stating here. Breakfasts were good , the room very clean and comfortable , the location very central to old istanbul sites and in a quiet cobble stoned street. Staff incredibly hospitable - all in all a wonderful stay say honestly it was one of the most enjoyable stays !I figured that I couldn't find a better value in all Istanbul. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “â€œGreat views from the Terrace roof!â€�”
Reviews.Author: aalborg80
Reviews.Content: We had a bad experience with the our firts Hotel we chose on arrival in Istanbul and happened upon the Ambassador .Firts Night, I was in the lobby and was on my computer for hours. The nice gentleman at the front desk, brought me a cup of apple tea with out me even asking, it was such a nice touch. The hotel also has free Wifi Internet what is such a great benefit for travelers. The location is very nice, right by the metro stop, and in a great main tourist area Negative . My room smelled like cleaning chemicals the whole stay.House-cleaners were very loud in the mornings in the hallway.. The elevator was slow, so I wanted to take the stairs, but the sensor did not lite up the stairs. The breakfast is very, very basic

Reviews.Title: “â€œValue For Your Moneyâ€�”
Reviews.Author: asmae x
Reviews.Content: Ambassador Hotel is perectly located just next to Blue Mosgue ,Hagia Sofie very closed to other Place and Museum . Welcome at hotel friendly staff with Compimentary glass of cahy and apple tea and other information Our room really small, could not open our luggage in room and when you going to Bathroom cant help Also a bit noisy during at night .We did stay at 102 .poeple at outdoor walked during midnight Room was clean staff was helpfull and freindly breakfast was ok Great View from Ambassador roof for breakfast We would highly recommend Ambassador to anyone visit t Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “â€œGreat Boutique Hotel - Very Well staffâ€�”
Reviews.Author: rosemin h
Reviews.Content: Ambassador hotel is a gem in a busy city. The staff are warm, friendly and helpful. Cannot ask for more. This was our first trip to Istanbul and we felt the warm hospitality of the people everywhere. Our room was always clean, large and comfortable.. Tea time is a nice treat in the lobby. The help desk offers assistance without even being asked and we felt at home right away. What a wonderful reception since it made us comfortable right away. Love Ambassador and recommend it to everyone visiting Turkey A big advantage is the free Wifi. They can also arrange city tours for you 25$. Forget about the large 5 star hotels -this is better than any of them. Thanks Ambassador for everything!

Reviews.Title: “â€œGreat locationl--Friendly Staffâ€� small rooms with Jacuzzi and there is no view!!!â€�”
Reviews.Author: Griboedov
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Istanbul and we stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Ambassador with my parent .We were not sure of the location, but found that it was close to the main attractions in Hagia Sopghia, all within walking distance. The staff were very helpful . Breakfast every morning available to be served on the terrace of the hotel with Blue Mosgues view. We booked two Junior Suite rooms and was disappointed and had concerns with both. Very cold as Air Conditioning was not working and water from one running shower. We had no views

Reviews.Title: “â€œGood location hotel with standard serviceâ€�”
Reviews.Author: ermou
Reviews.Content: Ambassador location is excellent near the tourists sites in Oldcity and close to the Sultanahmet Mosgue and Grand Baazar. Disappointing Turkish bath: Small sauna, cold hammam . Poor breakfast: no croissants, and they charged us a Espresso as an expensive extra. Bathroom was small, there was no bidet, and when we took a shower it flooded. Satellite TV was fuzzy and sound came and went. We needed to make an international phone call and phone line didn't work Overall the food, room , spa, gym, and free wifi were all acceptable. Nothing fantastic, but we didn't travel to Istanbul in search of Fabulous hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and great location”
Reviews.Author: steppy m
Reviews.Content: Ambassador Hotel is nestled is a side street about 10 minutes walk from the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosgue. TheJunior Suite room was modern , clean and large.Buffet breakfast was nothing special, but ok.chai and apple tea were available 15.30-16.30 with in lobby afternoon no extra cost. Staff at the front desk were helpful and the guest adviser Bunyamin was expert, charming and extremely knowledgeable. We felt part of Istanbul unlike being in the new city. We relaxed frequently in the Turkish Hamam , sauna and Gym in the basement. An excellent experience

Reviews.Title: “â€œTerrific Service,Beautiful Hotel â€�”
Reviews.Author: toronto_j155019
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful 5 night stay at the Ambassador Hotel Everyone there, from the reception , rbellboy , and housekeeping was warm, friendly and always willing to offer advice on how to get the most out of our stay.Consier service was excellent, they were so helpful and friendly with everything from planning our sightseeing, restaurant recommendations, and taxi service The hotel upgraded all three rooms we reserved from standard to Junior Suite, a very nice unexpected gesture. The decor is an eclectic modern and Istanbul photo traditional pieces that worked well and made for a very comfortable space. The rooms were quite large by hotel standards and the bath had nice amenities including a towel warmer and spa tub. Breakfast had a large selection of tasty , cold and hot dishes and the afternoon tea was a nice way to meet your fellow hotel guests. The location is great with most of the major sites in the Oldcity Sultanahmet area within an easy walk and public transportation was very close by. The neighborhood busy at night. Don't miss the beautiful roof terrace with views of the Marmara Sea,Hippodreme and Obeliks and minarets

Reviews.Title: “â€œ Try somewhere else firstâ€�”
Reviews.Author: Andrey z
Reviews.Content: We chose Ambassador Hotel as well because they offered a free Ataturk Airport, Free Transfer which was great since I wanted the trip to be as stress free as possible Ambassador Hotel easy walking distance of all the main sights; the location is brilliant, the staff are friendly and helpful and spoke good English; and the breakfas rooftop t is a definite +A - a buffet with a good selection of tasty food . Negatives: The inside rooms are small (I mean Mini !) and have no natural light at all. Essentially an 7ft by 7ft box with a double bed taking up most of the floor and very little storage space. The shower/toilet is even more cramped. I'm not big but I had difficulty getting to the wash basin without twisting sideways. The location is very convenient for seeing the sights in Oldcity but I would not stay there again and I do not reccomend Ambasssador Hotel . There are many other lovely hotels in Sultanahmet in the same price range with better amenties and better service

Reviews.Title: “We love your friendly staff & like all your location..we'll be back!=)”
Reviews.Author: manhattanNYCTania
Reviews.Content: We was grateful for the accommodating front desk who allowed my family and I to check in way before the designated check in time We like your friendly Staff and excellent service for my team October 28-30 and November 03-06 You are all like a family to all of us. We appreciate your staff kind assistance in the lobby, reception and room service. W e commend your Hotel. Allah bless you more guest. Insallah visit you hotel again Next years . :)

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view, and a turkish bath for you!”
Reviews.Author: Travellin_Mama_59
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived at the hotel around 10 a.m.. We were pleasantly surprised when they told us that they had a room available for us! The rooms were clean, the beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was newly renovated. The hotel is situated near the Blue Mosque. There is a restaurant located on the top floor of the hotel (5th floor) which provided a wonderful view of AyaSophia and the Blue Mosque. The hotel is also known as a historical site. Under the main floor, there is a turkish bath. Wow, what more could you ask for! The hotel also provides a continental breakfast and transfers to the airport, all for under 100e if you pay cash. I would definetaly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “â€œLovely Experience at the Ambassadorâ€�”
Reviews.Author: denise_david
Reviews.Content: It was our second time ,n Ambassador hotel October and hotel became our second home.due war m welcome and care of frontdesk staff always kind and nice and has a very good sense of humorf I would like thanks hotel front desk staff espically Bunyamin for always smile and helping for book my ticket for Kalkan and arrange for my half day walking city tours.NO NEEDED FOR TO GO SEE LANDMARK best advantage hotel lovely location .Our room was quite small but it was just two night. Cons:The toilet smelled a bit. No view at our room . The Toilet leaked at the edge due to there being a space between shower door and bath .Would love to come back again AMBASSADOR Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service for a budget hotel 5 Minutes away from everythingâ€�”
Reviews.Author: lucia f
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Ambassador Hotel when I stayed in October of 2011 The hotel is not too far from the old city and within 10 minutes walk to St. Sophia, Grand Bazaar and the Blue Mosque. A few minutes walk in the other direction will take you to a more vibrant and hip Istanbul where you can watch people go through their daily activities. The morning buffet was a virtual smorgassboard of Turksih n food, and the restauant provides a grand view of ships coming into port and a Near tram station. Discount for payment in cash. Staff helps with directions and will write addresses for taxi drivers. Pick-up at the airport..Lobbybar open at midnight. . Rooms cleaned everyday.Bunyamin, the front deskr, actually booked me into several other places in Turkey. His choices were also great. I recommend it with only reservation being stairs. Central location and cost make it ideal for short or long stay. Our room was small, but adequate. I didn't mind because I hardly spent time in there except only to sleep.All in all - I warmly recommand Ambassador Hotel if you need a cosy room (and a friendly faces) when ending a day of wondering around this beautiful city. For me it was good value for money. When I go back to Istanbul, I'm staying Ambassador Hotel again .

Reviews.Title: “Location, Terrace. stuff was great”
Reviews.Author: kelly r
Reviews.Content: Ambassador location was Lovely. We were able to walk to all the major attractions in Istanbul. We saved a lot of money by avoiding public transportation. The area is quiet and peaceful even though there are many stores. I enjoyed the relaxation of no yelling or honking (like from . They even have a grocery store and other shops on both sides of the hotel. The staff was generous. Especially, Ben, the receptionist. He let me use the internet and print from her computer to check in online. The beds were so comfortable. Perfect for about 2-3 days stay.

Reviews.Title: “DavÄ±dPenman”
Reviews.Author: DavÄ±d P
Reviews.Content: ThÄ±s hotel was our fÄ±rst vÄ±sÄ±t to Istanbul. The servÄ±ce was the best that I have come accross Ä±n a long tÄ±me. The rooms and restaurant were excellant. LocatÄ±on could not be better for a tourÄ±st Ä±n Istanbul. Blue Mosque and Grand Bazzar just a stones throw away. WorkÄ±ng Ä±n the aÄ±rlÄ±ne busÄ±ness I travel a lot and I am deffÄ±natelt spreadÄ±ng the Ä±nformatÄ±on regardÄ±ng thÄ±s hotel both to staff and travellers. Hotels rates are very attractÄ±ve and the staff are very warm and helpfull. WÄ±ll defÄ±nately use thÄ±s on my next vÄ±sÄ±t to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and sweet place”
Reviews.Author: JASSAS A
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 days/seven night at Ambassador Hotel from 5 to 12 October 2011, my arrivals was at night coming from Paris. The hotel managed a shuttle for me and i was directly and kindly moved to the hotel who is - for me - at the best place in Istanbul , between Aya sofia and The blue mosque. The personel is very cooperatif and well informed of ood activities in the town, all of them are multilingual and giving good advices and best prices for trips and events. Rooms are confortable and very clean, as well as the rest. The terasse retaurant where the free breakfast buffee is held every morning seems to be a part of a dream with an overview of the see, mosques and the old city. I realy recomand this hotel to the visitors of istanbul and wish a nice journey for them. Jassas AL AGHBARI Paris 16 October 2011

Reviews.Title: “My favorite memory Hotel in Europa!â€�”
Reviews.Author: MANDY K
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 night at Ambassador hotel beginning a Europa tour.I found location handy to Hagia Sophia,Topkapi Palace many Mosgue and tram.Liked Oldcity town feel of the black small str behind the Hagia Sophia sogukcesme str I could hear clearly from my room call prayer every early morning 5.30 Am .I had back room with a no wiev but Ä± raely spend much time in any hotel except to sleep and shower.Breakfast was ok on rooftop but had the same food each day Front desk were most accommodating For approximately 110$ night it was a good value I Would definitely stay Ambassador hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent great hotel for stay wit great teras and helpfull front desk”
Reviews.Author: alisa b
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 night Ambassador Hotel clean spacios room comp breakfast on rooftop garden top even better wiev for Mosgues and Marmara Sea hotel location is perfect for romantism :))I Front desk of Ambassador hotel is really honest and gives his host welcome to all costumer they spent every morning with most of the guest over apple tea and even recommended me how to make use of the time I had to visit as many palace as possible the Citytour that he recommended I will stay Ambassador again hesitationmede was really marvellous and non touristic great hotel for stay wit great teras and helpfull front desk

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Frank T
Reviews.Content: Reservations were made easy by email. The hotel is in super location. Every member of the front desk staff (Bunyamin) are knowledgeable and very helpful 24/7. Room maintenance staff is very good and courteous. Restaurant provides excellent buffet breakfast and good service each morning. Wonderful food, wine and terrace with an awesome view on which to dine in the evenings. Nice exercise room and Turkish bath with massage are great. The staff at the Hotel Ambassador made our experience in Turkey a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Ä°stanbul Oldcity”
Reviews.Author: c_walker111
Reviews.Content: Hotel have describe themselves as traditional and modern hotel .They are the most friendly staff I have ever seen in Europan Hotels that I have been Its like a family staff iwth taking care of their costumers to much help for your travel including non touristic restaurant places and ethnical food and drink We have very nice and cheap etnical Turkish food and Gipsy belly dancer really amazing performences room was ok however it was nice since we tasted totally authentic atmosphere room service clean and breakfast was nice great service I would recommend it for sure

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back :)”
Reviews.Author: mihaela_damian1006
Reviews.Content: It started as a "let's try it, we just need a clean room and a clean bathroom...". we discovered an excellently located small but very cosy hotel, nice modern style rooms, very clean. the rooms really tiny, but if you are there to visit the city, you don't care too much about the size of the room.... breakfast ok, although little or no specific food, but plenty of, so you could very well go for the city tour and stop to eat for dinner directly... I liked it, and so did my friends, so, we will come back :). for what you pay, it's really worth it ! thank you, Istanbul, I love you !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hossman59
Reviews.Content: Ambassador Hotel is in a fantastic location in Istanbul right opposite the Blue Mosque. Staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. The view from the roof terrace has to be one of the best in town. If you are looking for somewhere to stay in Istanbul you can't do much better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel ,welcoming atmosphere ,super staff and costumer service”
Reviews.Author: yuli h
Reviews.Content: Ambassador Hotel superior costumer service .From to moment you book on phone free shuttle organised to collect you at Ataturk airport .Front desk staff were very welcoming .we were provided with coctail and Turkish Delight and provided with map of Old City.Atmosphere Hotel was very friendlylike a family members of staff did all they could to accommodate all reguests and offer advice as wheer to eat what was expensive or cheap for ensure you were not atken for a ride Rooftop terrace restaurant on a warm summer evening theer is limited but adeguate menu inc some Turkish Wines.We spent 1night late evening dinner was supper and enoying Kebap and mesez Firts cal paryer came 2 different Mosgue breakfast was excellent Turkish selection cheeses,olives,Tukish pastries and some fresh fruitsWifi and Tv worked well .Overall the I found the Ambassador very relaxing with home sweet home feeling We would totaly come back Ambassador hotel

Reviews.Title: “spa review”
Reviews.Author: supertearz
Reviews.Content: my review is of the spa only, as i didn't stay in the hotel. i booked 2 massage treatments based on the glowing review lonely planet gave it. one back massage, one foot massage. the foot massage was great, it was very relaxing. the back massage was very mediocre though. i don't feel like the masseuse knew what he was doing. he used a forearm technique that i know from traditional chinese massages, and really hurt my back when his arm went over my back bones (the elbow is only supposed to knead muscles, never bones). in fact, i had a stiff neck for almost a week after my massage which has never happened to me before. it really wasn't worth the money at all and i was quite disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “4 single female traveller heaven of piece”
Reviews.Author: anna k
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Ambassador Hotel when I stayed in Semtember of 2011 The hotel is not too far from the old city and within 10 minutes walk to St. Sophia, Grand Bazaar and the Blue Mosque. A few minutes walk in the other direction will take you to a more vibrant and hip Istanbul where you can watch people go through their daily activities. The morning buffet was a virtual smorgassboard of Turksih n food, and the restauant provides a grand view of ships coming into port and a Near tram station. Discount for payment in cash. Staff helps with directions and will write addresses for taxi drivers. Pick-up at the airport..Lobbybar open at night. . Rooms cleaned everyday.hodge podge of rooves and minarets that periodically pop up in the skyline.Bunyamin, the front desk, actually booked me into several other places in Istanbul. His choices were also great. I recommend it with only reservation being stairs. Central location and cost make it ideal for short or long stay. My room was small, but adequate. I didn't mind because I hardly spent time in there except only to sleep.All in all - I warmly recommand Ambassador Hotel if you need a cosy room (and a friendly faceS) when ending a day of wondering around this beautiful city. For me it was good value for money. When I go back to Turkey, I'm staying Ambassador again .

Reviews.Title: “Solo Traveller says many Thanks”
Reviews.Author: Sam M
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a great location, decent quality room, and decent breakfast on a terrace with a fabulous view. The one MAJOR detail that makes this hotel a good place to stay is the staff. I was travelling alone, and a woman travelling alone is not always easy in Istanbul.The staff recommended sites/attractions that would be convenient for me, watched out for my return if I were to return late. Also, the staff is in my age group so we always had good conversations, and so I felt that I was not so alone. So, my special thanks to the staff at this hotel and I will now make Istanbul a weekend destination, and when that happens I will choose no other hotel, but Hotel Ambassador.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: nelliebell79
Reviews.Content: It was great! The staff was most helpful and friendly especially Bunyamin Ozkaplan. He has a vast amount of knowledge on where to go and the sights to see. The roof top has a wide selection yummy food and not to mention the WONDERFUL view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place that's really well located”
Reviews.Author: asangaw
Reviews.Content: I went through reviews of multiple hotels in the Sultanhmet section of Istanbul before settling for the Ambassador Hotel, and I wasn't disappointed. The staff were super efficient and friendly, the breakfast good, and the location fabulous! It's steps away from the Blue mosque, Ayya Sophia, Topkavi Palace, and the main tram line. The rooms were on the smaller end of things, but that's to be expected of any hotel in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - walk to everything”
Reviews.Author: maxiebon
Reviews.Content: this was my second stay at ambassador, when we came 2 years ago it was old and outdated but since then they have had a make over. Rooms are clean and small and bathrooms new but very small. Dont expect views from your room - the rooftop terrace is great for that. the biggest drawcard for this hotel is location. It is close to everything. Breakfast is ok, not fantastic but enough - although they need a toaster! Apart from that, if your not planning to spend huge amounts of time in your room then this hotel would be good for those looking to get out and about in istanbul. Staff are friendly and helpful and willing to suggest places to see and eat off the beaten track.

Reviews.Title: “in the middle of everything worth seeing in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: christinelv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not expensive and the male reseptionist are very service minded, he booked us cruise on the bousphoros, ticket to the ferry and everything with a smile. The breakfast is not international, but it has the essentials pluss a little bit more. Im glad not everywhere do english breakfast, its good that some hotels offer turkish breakfast when we actually is in Turkey. The hotel is close to the grand bazaar, blue mosque, the hagia sofia and the water reservoir. Restaurants everywhere just as you step outside the hotel. They have a roof terrasse with a chill area and an eating area. You can eat breakfast and chill out with drinks up here with a stunning view of the bosphorous or the marmara sea. The room is ok, I dont like carpets on the floor, but the size was good, bathroom was nice and clean. We will stay here again next time we come. I also had a massage in the downstairs hammam and it was like heaven but the space is a little small for me and the massagist.This hotel gives you value of your money, and good service from most the staff. the most important is that its ok priced and in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, amenities, and wildly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NikkiGSofia
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled to Istanbul with my best friend for our first adventure in Turkey. We were brought to the Ambassador by a friend's recommendation and it far exceeded our expectations - they even picked us up from the airport for free! The location is simply unbeatable, close to every major touristic site. Even better though is the view of the Blue Mosque and the Ayasofia from our breakfast terrace (breakfast was amazing, by the by). The staff was phenomenally helpful - they set up boat cruises and stepped in when we had no idea what to do with our last day. Everyone spoke great English and really just went out of their way to make sure we had the best stay possible.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views from roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: maxtedandlily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an amazing location with gorgeous views of the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sophia. You can almost touch the mosque speaker so you can really hear the call to prayer!!! The guys in the bar and the porter were lovely. Front desk average. The room was simple but clean and enough room for 3 of us. Breakfast was comprehensive but we were nervous when we saw it being put out one hot night at midnight.....not good to have food out for 7 hours!! Great location in sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Happy for 5 Nights!”
Reviews.Author: JoseRizal
Reviews.Content: Lonely Planet lists this hotel as a hamam. The location is where LP thumbnail's the location of Hotel Nomade. The area is touristy, with touristy restaurants, shops, McDonalds and Starbucks along Divan Yolu towards the direction of the Grand Bazar. Had the pleasure of staying in two room types: A Family Room (Sleeps 4/ 2 Split Type ACs/ Large Toilet with Tub. Located on the 5th floor where the breakfast terrace is. So very convenient during breakfast time or you want to gaze at Floodlit views of Aya or the Blue Mosque at night) and Double Room (Sleeps just for two, Centralized AC no thermostat/ Small toilet and shower only). The room interiors are sparse and light (think Ikea), Flat Screen TV (BBC & CNBC English Channels and the rest are Turkish and European Cable News Channels). Breakfast is a notch higher than the European standard. I tried the hamam. No hanky panky. Worth trying a Turkish Bath but be prepared to plug your ears and nose if you don't want to feel getting pseudo water boarded. Not spectacular but worth trying for the cultural experience. Lastly, I admire this hotel for the staff: Nuray for her readiness to assist with a smile and Hamdi for his readiness to engage you in humorous chatter (again with a smile).

Reviews.Title: “perfect rooms, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Payam_Vakil
Reviews.Content: It was in wonderful place,, just couple of minutes walk from sultanehmet station and very close to istanbuls best tourist sites. rooms are clean, modern and well furnished, our rooms view was not perfect but there was rooms with greatest view possible,, also staff were very friendly.. Internet speed was not very good but acceptable (~100 KB/s) I really look forward to go to Istanbul and stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “nothing special for Ambassador”
Reviews.Author: kelly_love_kobe
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in May . The hotel is generally above average hotell, very nice furniture for three stars , I could get a lot of four-star hotel rooms compete. Price is very reasonable compared to what the hotel offers you. The location of the hotel is very close to the center of the historical peninsula. The owner and the staff are very helpful. The owner even took us to some of the historical places nearbyt. Public transport is also a very good, at the corner of the street there is a tram stop, which from we can go the airport and the Spice Bazaar :) comfortably. All in all, I was completely satisfied with the accommodation. I saw that many people was saying that the rooms are small ... I would say rather that it is not large, but would not say they are too small. Also, my room card was not working and I was not given a new one and always escorted to my room, I felt like a teenager under curfew. Please Don't forget to bring your ear plugs as you will hear people walking and talking around your room, especially in the morning. Breakfast is only served between 7.30 and 10 am. What they serve is ok for 1 or 2 days, but somewhat limited for a longer stay. Not perfect but I think you get worth for your money. Tips:Unless you really are looking for a carpet/rug, donâ€™t talk to friendly people around the Hagia Sophia; they will lead you to a carpet shop and it will be hard to get away in less than one hou

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff-very convinient location”
Reviews.Author: nasou57760
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ambassador Hotel during our Orthodox Easter Holidays. The hotel location is very convenient (very close to all important monuments of Istanbul) and hotel's staff very kind and helpful. I am very pleased to have met all those nice people and Ambassador hotel will be my accomodation next time I' ll visit Istanbul. Thank you for everything guys!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: john3429
Reviews.Content: Central to all sights, airport pickup very convenient, helpful staff, very good breakfast on roof looking over Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque, modern well appointed rooms. Bathroom small but manageable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very quiet”
Reviews.Author: CaptBill2
Reviews.Content: This is a 10 room hotel on a side street on an attractive dead-end off of a traffic free side street. It is an extremely quiet location in the midst of this historic district. The area is packed with restaurants, other hotels, seems lively at all times. One block from the tram station and very close to the biggest tourist sites in the country namely the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia Mosque museum and the TopkapÄ± Palace among other things. Great location. Rooms are all up to date with new bathrooms. Very decent furniture and a refrigerator in every room. The room had windows that open wide on to this closed street giving great fresh air with no pollution or traffic. I paid $80 per night for a single including a one-way transfer from the airport. I received a 5% discount for cash. A very good breakfast buffet in the breakfast room/restaurant on the top floor with a sensational view of the city and its monuments. A real asset that they have is Nuray at the front desk who is on top of everything; arranging cars, recommendations for sightseeing etc. There is nothing that she doesnâ€™t know or will not do. A big asset to them. A great place to stay at a good price in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jessruth
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. I couldn't have been happier with my choice. Not only the location is great -walking distance to most popular sites plus a wonderful view of the Blue Mosque from the terrace and dining area- but everyone at the hotel was extremely nice! The hotel is very clean, the rooms are very comfortable and the selection at breakfast was very good. And the price was great, with breakfast and one-way trip to or from the airport included. We visited Istanbul with our children (ages 16 and 10) and another family with children ages 7,10 and 15 and we all loved it. Thank you Nuray, Bunyamin and Ozan at the reception! You made our stay so comfortable and easy! Thank you Sezgin! You were always smiling and attentive at the dining room! Your chats, cookies and snacks after a long day of sightseeing were a treat to our children and unforgetable to us! I highly recommend this hotel! I wouldn't even look into any other place if we were to go back to istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Building a memory.”
Reviews.Author: g1tzc
Reviews.Content: From the moment I found the Ambassador Hotel online I had nothing but praise for them. The trip was a late Valentines gift for my wife so I asked the hotel for flowers and Turkish delight in the room. I was sent a link to a local florist to choose the flowers and they were exactly as shown. On arriving at Ataturk Airport, we were greeted by the courtesy transfer driver. A clear name board and a small - always a good start. Istanbul traffic being as it is the transfer took a little longer than you would expect, but he knew his way around traffic jams so you even got to see some of the tiny cobbled streets that Istanbul has to offer. We arrived at the hotel, which is about 1 min from the mail street. The bellboy took us from the main street to the hotel to check it. The receptionist was very attentive and efficient. Within 5 minutes all the formalities were out of the way. The room was a good size. Also clean and tidy with crisp, fresh white linen and bath robes neatly folded. Even the detail of slipperettes. The shower room was a little small, but perfectly clean and tidy. Once we had rested a while, we dropped back to reception to ask a few "tourist questions" which were answered clearly. The tram stop is just at the bottom of the street - make sure you turn right otherwise you end up walking to the next tram stop which is a long way. We are already looking forward to our next stay and will not stay anywhere else. Thank you to all the staff at the Ambassador for making our stay an extra special time.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable time”
Reviews.Author: traveler12057
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at Ambassador Hotel and we loved it. Everyone was so friendly from driver over waiter, room maid to reception. The driver was there on time to meet us, the receptionists gave us plenty of ideas to help us getting around and the rooms were very clean. My husband and I we enjyod a Turkish massage. A fabulous experience. At first we had a soap massage in the steam bath and after that an oil massage. Also our children loved the Turkish bath. It was just what we needed after a long walk through the city. The terrace restaurant is just great in the evenings. You can see the Blue Mosque and St. Sophia right in front of you. Just beautiful. We hope to be back soon to see more of Istanbul and should we, we will definately stay at Ambassador Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok - Expected A Bit More”
Reviews.Author: Nikkigall
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews I had high hopes for this hotel. I got a great rate for a single room and appreciated the included airport pick-up. I also used the car service for an airport drop off as well. Communication after making my reservation was great. After arriving at the airport I didn't find anyone holding a sign with my name - so I called the hotel and was told the driver would be there in 5 min due to traffic - perfectly understandable as I'm well familiar with Istanbul. Connected with the driver and we were off. Arrival at the hotel was fine, check-in was easy but the front desk attendant left much to be desired - I inquired about the metro and was given a bit of basic information then told to come back after going up to my room and she would explain it to me. I came back an hour later and the attendant just stared at me - I inquired again about the metro and got a rather indifferent response so I didn't pursue it anymore. The great thing is the metro is literally around the corner and very easy to use. I didn't figure out how to purchase the electronic pass until the next day which was also my last day but this is a bit cheaper than purchasing individual tokens as is noted in other posts on Istanbul. The hotel room was fine - simple furnishing, clean and came with a decent array of toiletries. I had requested a room away from the elevator - this worked well as I did hear a bit of steps in the evening but not as much had I been at the other end of the very short hallway. I could not figure out the television and was unable to connect to the internet my entire stay - there appeared to be no signal in the room and while strong in the lobby I still couldn't "join the network". The breakfast buffett was full of typical turkish delights and a few hot items - nothing elaborate. The view from up top was fantastic and for those interested in the Blue Mosque and all the other tourist sites this is a great location. Check-out was fine and they held my bags as I had 4+ hours till my trip back to the airport. The trip back to the airport was issue free. Overall I think this is an affordable choice with a fantastic location for simple yet clean surroundings. I was not impressed by the indifferent and unattentive attitude of the front desk which unfortunately set the wrong tone as far as the hotel was concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: core64
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, we could walk to Blue Mosque and basars. All staff was very nice and helped us a lot to get around city. Mostly we enjoyed view from breakfast room and the many choices for breakfast. We tried a Turkish massage by Zeki and it was wonderful. He is a really good masseur. The rooms were nice decorated and very clean. We hope to be able to return to this hotel and recommend it to everyone who want to go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: eyejean
Reviews.Content: It's always difficult to find a good hotel that is also great value for money on the web. This is a hotel with a family atmosphere...home away from home. The whole experience from making my booking online, through check-in and changing my stay while traveling was excellent. Nothing was to difficult to organize and every member of the Ambassador team contributed to my experience. Early check-in - no extra cost and no problem (did advise of my arrival time.) I can't wait to visit again in summer so that I can enjoy breakfast on the terrace restaurant with its fabulous views over the Blue Mosque

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: zarin21
Reviews.Content: all hotel staff were helpful espcially ben; good location clean and quiet rooms ;breakfast had lot of varieties ;enjoyed the view of blue mosque while having breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and Ben is awesome”
Reviews.Author: Mula-Ida
Reviews.Content: We never regret stayed in this hotel, the location is unrivaled, the roof terrace although is not that big but has fantastic view, Blue Mosque and TopKapi Palace are in front of our eyes. The staff are friendly, especially Ben, he is a great person and very helpful. His friendliness makes us feel that we have known him for years. Thank you so much Ben for recommending places to visit, showing direction we want to go, borrowing umbrella:)-

Reviews.Title: “worth the value”
Reviews.Author: Daud_fellow
Reviews.Content: very nice new renovated hotel, location is great although a bit difficult to find because it goes to small alley. In Istanbul the name of the street a bit hard to find. Near to main tourist attraction in Sultanahmet area and the hotel staff quite helpful. I was check in very early in the morning and they did not required extra charges to me.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location and friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jezhuggins
Reviews.Content: The Ambassador Hotel is a great hotel to stay in for sightseeing in Istanbul. We had a wonderful time there, finding the staff most helpful in guiding us where to go and what to do etc. We will return. Near to the tram line for easy access. Clean and comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “5-star location and cleanliness, everything else average at best”
Reviews.Author: braneout
Reviews.Content: The good: was able to book very late and still get rooms on a busy weekend. The location cannot be beat, and the maid service kept the room sparkling. Bad: breakfast is dodgy, service in the rooftop restaurant is poor at best, rooms are quite small, downstairs Turkish bath is by appt. only. None of these should be too bothersome if you intend to spend most of the time out and about.

Reviews.Title: “awsome place”
Reviews.Author: angela35394
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful and nice place to stay would tell anyone to go there...also ben at the front desk is wonderful person helps you when needed.He never says no and always trys to help in anyway he can..The hotel is beautiful place to.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: greatatforty
Reviews.Content: wonderful service great location very clean the people i met were great front desk the young gentlman Ben always with a smile just a great pleasure to see someone clean speaks english and never said no to whatever i aske or for help with anything would i go back to ambassador hotel ohh yes i intend to go back to istanbul i will bring my friend's from the usa again Ben stay sweet and show ur smile thankyou for making my trip so much easier.....sincerely

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GREAT STAFF, GREAT SERVICES”
Reviews.Author: khorrami
Reviews.Content: We had very good stay in this hotel for a week, all staff were very nice, just like friends, break fast was very delicious, view on the terrace was breathtaking."sultanahmad tram station" was 100 meter far from hotel. Many main attractions were around us. 100% if i back to istanbul i will be there. with special thanks to "Norai" & "Ismail ustunkatya" & all staffs of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location But small rooms”
Reviews.Author: koko_waki
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at the ambassador hotel for a week, the location is excellent, the staff is friendly, the hammam is very good, the breafast is good, but the rooms are very small and the housekeeping are not professional at all !! as it seems they come in and go out but the room and the bathroom is the same. I recommend this hot to solo travelers and budget tourists only.

Reviews.Title: “We always feel like we're coming home.”
Reviews.Author: elsie31
Reviews.Content: We stayed, this time, at the Ambassador for nine days. This was our longest visit, and, arguably, our best. The hotel had a complete renovation in February, and while we miss the older, more casual ambiance, just a little, the improvements far out-weigh the lost, lovably shabby decor. The smart new lobby is better laid out, and still very welcoming. The seating both there and in the bar has expanded, and welcomes conversation over tea or wine. Best of all are the very comfortable new beds, with bedside lamps, and the re-modeled bathrooms. The managment did a great job with this. The professional reception staff, Nuray, Benyamin, and Ozan, are anxious to help with just about anything, and are without fail friendly and attentive. They keep track of messages, luggage, and groups of friends trying to connect with each other. The cook does a bang-up job of creative breakfast buffets, and presents excellent Turkish cuisine for lunch and dinner. The masseur is popular all over the neighborhood; he serves guests from other hotels as well as those of the Ambassador, in his lovely massage center complete with mini-hamam. The cleaning and wait staff are efficient, friendly and adaptable. Finally, the view from the terrace is simply incomparable. Located directly across from the Blue Mosque (the entrance is on a little picturesque alley paralleling Divanyolu) and in full view of Hagia Sophia and the Hippodrome, we have found no other hotel to be a better value than the Ambassador. It is definitely our home in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect find”
Reviews.Author: Laumilo
Reviews.Content: The Ambassador had pleasant decor, a friendly staff, 24 hour bell desk and the best location in Istanbul.. From the roof top terrace one viewed the Blue Mosque on one side and to the left the Hagla Sophia, both brightly lit at night for Ramadan. After you explore the nearby sights of the historic city the light rail tram stop is nearby to easily whisk you to the modern Taksim for the nightlife and other attractions. The hotel is surrounded by many sidewalk restaurants to fit any budget, some very impressive cooking skills. For the price we paid it was truly a bargain, and the Turkish breakfast was the best of many I have enjoyed during my visits to Turkey. The staff arranged transport and suggested they provide a light 3 am breakfast for our early am departure. This helpful attitude extended from our arrival to departure. I might suggest that during Ramadan one might try to book rooms 104, 204 etc. (No view but an air shaft, but sheltered from the night time festivities in the large park between the hotel and the Blue Mosque) I'd also recommend Ramadan as a great time to visit, aside from the heat, since there are all sorts of free musical events nearly every evening amid a very festive atmosphere. (Dervish dancing to Elvis doing Jail House Rock - on a unicycle!) Just can't say enough to recommend this hotel. WW

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: myrags
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Istanbul and the Ambassador Hotel was the perfect place to stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful - I even had a nice late-night chat one night with a man at the reception, where he offered me complimentary apple tea, which I thought was very sweet. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the location of the hotel is excellent as it is within walking distance of the major tourist attractions such as the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia. It's also on the doorstep of many bars, cafes and restaurants. The breakfast at the hotel was lovely, and I often went back for 2nds or even 3rds! The balcony on which we had breakfast had a wonderful view over the city. This hotel also has a taxi service from the airport, so getting there and back was simple and easy. If I went back to Istanbul I would definitely stay at this hotel again!! :)

Reviews.Title: “just like home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: asif295412
Reviews.Content: My stay was of 8 days and everyday was more than comfortable and taken care of us. The staff was really nice and well mannered and very caring. Two of our favourites were and still will be Bunyamin and Nooray at the front desk.A big thanks to them as without them the stay would be good but not that worth staying.Also upstairs on the terrece in the morning breakfast time , Rajab was the best.It is obvius that when in Istanbul next time, we will be guests at theIstanbul Ambassador Hotel. Thumbs up !

Reviews.Title: “My trip to Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: AnitaSimone
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the period of 6 nights. I loved every thing about it. staff were fantastic and i have to mention one of the staff (BENJI), that totally went above and behind his duty to make me feel good. I would carry this memory for years to come! Simone

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: sardopt
Reviews.Content: Could not be better located, within walking ditance of all major attractions in Sultanahmet, the tram line and shopping. Trendy decor, friendly and accomodating staff and rates that are very competitive. Rooftop with veiws to die for. Highly recommended. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive service, restful stay, fantastic views, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: blueseabluesky
Reviews.Content: We booked a family room for 6 days as we were travelling with our son. There weren't much information about the family room online and we were initially apprehensive. However, on arrival, we found the family room to be fine. It is basically two rooms with a single room opening into a bigger, double room. There is no sitting area but the rooms are comfortable enough. We are here on a conference and judging from the reports from others at the conference, rooms in the sultan ahmet areas are generally small. So - Hotel ambassador actually compares favourably. Compared to other boutique hotels, this particular hotel may not have the more "traditional" charms but a colleague moved out of one such hotel to ambassador because he found the other place to be uncomfortably small. So, yes - photographs can be deceptive. Rooms in Hotel Ambassador may not be large and the website may lack the charms of other hotels but we were perfectly happy with our stay for the following reasons. 1. we have read much about the roof terrace and it is true. The view from the terrace is fabulous. 2. The rooms are comfortable and spotless. The bathrooms are excellent. The rooms themselves don't have much of a view but they are quiet as the hotel is tucked away in a corner. We didn't find the prayer calls a problem at all. I slept through some nights and on the two nights when I heard the call, I drifted back to sleep easily enough. As the rooms we were in are not facing any streets, restaurants or bars - we really had restful nights. 3. the best thing about the hotel is the friendly and helpful team - ayhan (who has just left), benjamin and ismail provided excellent service. They are the reason why we prefer small hotels. The staff made our stay in Turkey memorable. My only suggestion to the hotel is for them to improve their breakfast. The breakfast is adequate but it gets repetitive. With the big range of summer fruit available in the market, I am just surprised that there were not more options. It would also be nice if they could provide turkish coffee rather than the disappointing nescafe as part of the breakfast. However, it is hard to be dissatisfied when you can break your fast to view of the blue mosque and aya sofia. If you are staying there for 1 or two days, this will not be an issue. However, we have been here for a week and do look forward to some variety. We noticed some complaints about the air-conditioning and were also concerned. However, we stayed in two different rooms and had no problem with the air-conditioning at all. The family room comes with its own air-conditioning unit but the junior suite on the 4th floor is cooled by the central system. It is not chilly and this may be a problem for those who like really cold rooms but it cools the room to a comfortable level, We are so comfortable with the place and we have booked to stay in ambassador again on our return leg in August.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the centre of the historic town”
Reviews.Author: SB_ANorthampton
Reviews.Content: The Ambassador hotel is lovely. Right in the centre of all the main, historic, attractions and within a few minuets walking distance of the Blur Mosque, it is ideally situated for a great stay in Istanbul. The staff are very helpful an friendly, we really enjoyed the attention and advice from our waiter Sezgin, who went out of his way to make our stay most enjoyable. The breakfast had a good selection of cold and hot food (not European) and the bars well welcoming and comfortable. The rooms were definitely smaller than they appear in the photos on the website but were comfortable, not much room for unpacking though. All in all it was a great stay and we will go back to this hotel every time we visit Istanbul. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Grat value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JeanGulliver
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Ambassador 4 years ago and enjoyed its quiet location in the heart of the old part of Istanbul. This stay however was even better because of their recent renovation. The lobby is attractive with a pleasant small bar area, rooms are small but well appointed, the baths are very well done with marble tile and excellent showers. The rooftop restaurant for breakfast has wonderful views but the breakfast is a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “No airconditioning”
Reviews.Author: Al117
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have stayed in Ambassador Hotel during last month on two occasions in three different rooms. The airconditioning was not working in any of the rooms. Despite several reclamations to the staff, the problem wasn't fixed. The airconditioning was blowing only hot air. During the summer heat in Istanbul this means that the rooms are very uncomfortably hot and also somewhat smelly. Obviously the a/c is broken in the whole hotel or they try to save money by not turning it on. Otherwise the hotel's location is excellent for Sultanahmet's sights, the rooms are newly renovated (although some of televisions are very complicated to use), there is not too much noise (because the "view" from the rooms is towards the walls of other buildings), the personnel are friendly, and views from the rooftop terrace are lovely. If they would fix the problem with airconditioning, I would be pleased to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great service”
Reviews.Author: dflewelling
Reviews.Content: this hotel is awesome great service very friendly awesome service ben is awesome hes good man great worker

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great value”
Reviews.Author: jackperhaps
Reviews.Content: I am glad I chose this hotel for my stay in Istanbul. The location is great. The view from the roof top terrace is amazing. For the money, the facilities and services offered are a great value. The staff are also great, especially Ben and Sezgin. It would be nice if the TV had more international channels, but all and all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location- Skip the Hotel Turkish Bath”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler189
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ambassador hotel. I chose it because of its central location and a modern hotel in a historical area. I got what I asked for, fine rooms, good breakfast and wonderful views from their roof top terrace. I would recommend staying here as the hotel staff is very helpful. On the other hand, I was very disappointed with their turkish bath/massage they offer. Upon my arrival I was required to fill out a variety of paper work, spoken to gruffly and had to listen to Pop music (including trance) while I was scrubbed during my Turkish Bath. A real disappointment. Go find a local Turkish Bath for a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in the best location”
Reviews.Author: jeanlouisdiaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights at the Ambassador Hotel and enjoyed it immensely. The staff were all efficient and very friendly, especially Erhan at reception for whom no request was too much trouble - from organising our laundry to be washed, to recommending a tour on the Bosphorus. He also arranged a new room for us as our initial room on the first floor was very dim - we were given a top floor room that had lots of windows and natural light. Breakfast is served on the roof terrace - definitely the best views in the Sultanahmet - stunning at any time of the day and especially after dark. Location to all the sights was just a few minutes walk, so we regularly made pit-stops at the hotel during the day. Being near a main street made it very easy to catch a tram and find somewhere to eat. Though the hotel entrance is hidden away down a quiet lane which makes it a little tricky to find, but offers a sheltered entrance. Breakfast and maid staff were also exceptional; breakfast offered a good selection of both Western and Turkish food.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
