Reviews.Author: suzannedebruin
Reviews.Content: I stayed alone a couple of days in this very nice hotel, it was clean and it looked new. the staff was very friendly and especially benjamin help me a lot to get around. Suzanne

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: Welsie
Reviews.Content: This place has one of the best locations. View from the breakfast room is sensational. View from the room was not good and rooms are quite small, which is the only bad point. The quality of the rooms are good and of course the location.

Reviews.Title: “very good an friendly people”
Reviews.Author: huddzshell
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this nice hotel, i came with some girl friends, we stayed 4 day very friendly nice staff expecally ben who work night shifts. he made are stayed very nice poliet gentelman,its closed to blue mosgue and hagÄ±a sopgÄ±a 100meter breakfast amazÄ±ng Ä±n rooftop,but we dont have room vÄ±ew and room lÄ±ttle bÄ±t smal i would recommend it 2 all people stayin in istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful and really made our stay”
Reviews.Author: NBA09
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel for a first visit to Istanbul based on a newspaper review and were not disappointed. Staff all really helpful, plenty of useful tips about what to do but no hard sell on the organised outings. Really great location (2mins from Blue Mosque etc) and the recently refurbished room was stylish and comfortable (albeit a bit small - but that's not surprising). Breakfast on the roof terrace with picture postcard views was fantastic and my mum (travelling companion) raved about the Turkish massage in the hotel spa. Few teething troubles following the recent refurb - we had a leaky shower tray but nothing we couldn't handle. Might be a bit noisy in high season when fully booked but OK for us.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: exnih
Reviews.Content: Glad to hear that the hotel is under reconstruction. That will make it a real jewel in the Istanbul Old Town. It's location, and the terrace view - unbeatable!

Reviews.Title: “Ambassador Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurenceb1
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying 5 nights at this Hotel. The Hotel was undergoing a total refurbishment when we were staying there and we were worried that this would disturb our stay. On arrival our receptionist apologised for the disruption however we really didn't experience any problems at all. Yes a few workmen the smell of fresh paint the odd bang / crash, but as we only spent about 8 hours a day at the hotel it didn't affect us. We were in a newly refurbished room which was spotless and functional. We had plenty of space for the three of us, beds comfortable, flat screen TV and mini bar. Air conditioning fully working. The Hotel also has a spa. The hotel was quiet and cosy. When it's finished this hotel will look fantastic. Breakfast was a typical Turkish breakfast, plenty to fill up on before you start sightseeing. The hotel also provides evening meals on request. The Hotel couldn't be better placed, just off the main Divan Yolu Cadessi, right near the Sultanahamet tram stop. All the main sights of Sultanahamet are within walking distance so perfect for little legs. I can't speak highly enough of the staff at the Ambassador who were lovely Mr. Erhan KÅ±gÅ±karas was very helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. We stayed at the Nena a few years ago which was lovely, but the Ambassador for us was much better. Laurence

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay”
Reviews.Author: freakazoid
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here with my family on a pleasure trip. My skepticism about this hotel was blown away by the cleanliness and hospitality of the staff. In particular, Mr. Erhan KÅ±gÅ±karas was extremely cordial, friendly and helpful. The property is neither large nor luxurious but is safe, neat and clean with modern amenities. As a first time visitor, I found it extremely convenient to stay in the heart of busy historic district of Istanbul. I could see the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia Museum from the roof terrace during breakfast. These historic sites as well as other places of interests are only few minutes walk from the hotel. I plan to stay at the Ambassador Hotel in my next trip there. I would highly recommend this hotel to those who do not have unlimited budget yet want to see the historic part of Istanbul effortlessly.

Reviews.Title: “If you're happy with 1 step up from a hostel, stay here”
Reviews.Author: smilerteg
Reviews.Content: We had booked 5 nights in this hotel, but lasted only 2. The location may be great (once you find it - it's tucked away in a back street with no signage at all - we ended up getting help from a local), but beyond that, and a very nice receptionist, there is little to recommend this place. The rooms are beyond basic, very ugly and small with nowhere to unpack anything. The bathroom was horrid, with a smashed soap dish and stained floor. The breakfast has to be the worst I've had in a long time, and we spent as little time in there as we possibly could. If you normally stay at a youth hostel this might be fine, and as I've said, the location is brilliant for th Sultanahmet sights, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: zoeismom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an excellent location close to historical places. The hotel staff was very kind and helpful. The front desk clerks were especially kind and helpful. We received so much information about the city and things for us to do from Erhan at he front desk, he is right person for that. If you have questions ask him if it is your first time there and he will help you. I highly recommend this hotel if you are in Turkey. Thank you Erhan for all of your help.

Reviews.Title: “Fab and in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: trixiebelles
Reviews.Content: Very well placed hotel in the Sultanahmet area and only a short distance to many of the cityâ€™s top touristy attractions like Aya Sophia Museum, the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar, Turkish and Islamic Museum, Topkapi Palace, the Hippodrome, Yerebatan Sarayi Cistern and several souvenir shops and restaurants. I love that this hotel is located near a tram stop that will give you access to other parts of the city and places of tourist interest. Itâ€™s also great to have the treat of spa/sauna and massage and use of the fitness centre to stay in shape whilst on holiday. This is such a relaxed and calming environment with a beautiful aroma and lots of color. Some of the massages are a bit over-priced and don't expect to get the price you read in Lonely Planet. This hotel offers free use of computers in the lobby and wi-fi internet access in your room. Should you forget your book the lobby has a selection of interesting books to read too. As for the rooms; they could seriously do for a more modern makeover but you still get a goodnightâ€™s rest. The restaurant food is pretty good; I had the Turkish meatballs served with chips and rice with a glass of Efes beer. The restaurant also has a terrace that offers really good views of the Blue Mosque and various Sultanahmet sites. Hotel staff are wonderful, helpful and friendly. Front desk, Benjamin, Erhan and Nuray and restaurant staff speak very good English. If you want a great recommendation on good restaurants and shops please see Benjamin. This guy gives really good advice. Who could ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Money's worth”
Reviews.Author: digvijayps
Reviews.Content: Four of us had taken a cruise ex Copenhagen & on our way back we planned to stay in Istanbul for three days. we booked this Hotel through Otel.com for one day, hoping to extend our stay there if found suitable. It so happened that they did not have rooms for susequent days & we had to shift out. Be that as it may, our one night stay in the hotel was money's worth essentially because of its fantastic location & its super view from the terrace where b'fast is also served . Blue Mosque & many other monuments could be seen from the terrace top & we took some fabulous pictures from there. In fact we had the pleasure of feeding sea gulls who come visiting the roof-top restaurant. We alsp spent a lovely evening on the roof top where nice seating has been arranged 7 you can enjoy your drinks there. The rooms were in keeping with the low 100 usd- tarrif. Bathrooms a trifle small but ok. Unfortunately in our friend's room the air-condtioner did not work well, despite complaint & their effort to set it right the locationin popular Sultanet Ahmet could not be better with a lively market right out side the hotel & plenty of restaurants & bars to choose from.The Mosque & other monuments were at a stone's throw& Trains & bus stops merely 50 meters away. a special word of praise for the staff who were very helpfull & cooperative. Two negatives : the hotel is 20-30 meters from the road where taxi drops you. A narrow but lively cobbled lane takes you to the hotel. No bell-boys to help you with your luggage. Secondly , the b'fast. It was mediocre. Over all , we would have loved to extend our stay in this small but happy hotel

Reviews.Title: “Just brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: carableueyez
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. Would certainly return in the future. Everything was just brilliant. Close proximity to tram line and walking distance to several great tourist attractions. Very good place to for a wind down. Front desk staff are great. Especially Bunyamin who gives great advice on where to go and things to do off the beaten path. Getting the spa treatment and a massage is a must. Overall I would say I really enjoyed this visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great loctaion and very freindly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kimlina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and located very close to the major attactions of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Aqua Duct and the metro is only 200 metres away. The Grand Bazar, the Spice Bizar are also in easy walking distance. The view from the roof top restaurant is terrific. The staff are very friendly and helpful and could not do enough for us. thanks to all the staff and particularly Bunyamin for his help with transfers and eating recomendations. We will stay here again. Thanks Kim & Lina Australia

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: flunkme
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent and ofcourse the Ambassador has the best rooftop terrace in Istanbul. It was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough about it”
Reviews.Author: judgedread28
Reviews.Content: My 70 something year old parents, wife and I had a week long stay at this hotel. This was my third visit to Istanbul and wanted to stay some place different that I felt would cater to a mature group. I would say this is the ideal place if you want a hotel that is comfortable, quiet, clean and not full of college kids. Not the prettiest rooms but you'll love it here. This hotel has wonderful ammenities including easy access to tram, airport shuttle service, a relaxing spa and massage service (don't leave home away from home without it), a great roof top restaurant that offers a breath taking view of this magnificent city. Customer service is some of the best that I have had in Europe and I travel to Europe quite often. Front desk reception Benjamin is simply the best; always willing to go out of his way to make our stay a happy one. Mom and dad love this guy! If you want to be near some of the best tourist sites I would definately recommend staying at this hotel. Great location, incredible customer service, spa treatment and more.

Reviews.Title: “A+”
Reviews.Author: VARNA_BULGARIA
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location. We enjoyed our stay in Istanbul/Turkey at this hotel. The staff is very knowledgeable. We asked for the best nightlife places in the city and the front desk representative ( I believe Erhan) was very helpful in guiding us to the right places. English is well spoken everywhere so we did not have any problems communicating.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and staff in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Corazza
Reviews.Content: I've just came back from 4 amazing days in Istanbul and staying at Ambassador Hotel was a crucial decision to enjoy the fantastic experiences the city offers. Great location. You can walk to every must-see spots and has the tram stop only 2 blocks away. Cross the street and you're in front of Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Could not have been more helpful and friendly staff, especially Benjamin. Close to the hotel you will find dozens of good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: yelkenci_9
Reviews.Content: The rooms were in line with what you'ld expect from a 3 star, well maintained and clean, but a little on the small side. Great location (can walk to everything and in the middle of good restaurants) and has a super staff. Could not have been more helpful and friendly. My wife commented on how she liked their chocolate cookies, and how they would be great with dates or raisons. The next day they were on the table. She said how great they were, and we received two complimentary freshly baked bags. Did not get this service in the 5 star we visited in Izmir.

Reviews.Title: “my sole accomodation”
Reviews.Author: hasan_goksu
Reviews.Content: i have recently stayed at the Ambassador hotel in Istanbul Turkey,the hotel staff was friendly especially Eran who was working in front desk. He was really polite, and helpful .The rooms were quite pleasent and the food was nice i would come back again... from USA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaFamily2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked up a small walk street off a small road. It's a nice quiet location, but very close to the local attractions. It's located within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, and other major sites. There is a tram station about 2 blocks away. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed at another hotel in Istanbul at the end of our vacation, at it was not nearly as nice. The buffet breakfast included a mixture of traditional and Turkish foods. Very good value for the price. We'd be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lornylorn
Reviews.Content: I have just recentley came back from staying at the Ambassador hotel in Istanbul Turkey,i would come back to here again and again,the location of the hotel was nice of a little side street ,Once i was in the hotel the staff was friendly and polite,as i was on my own the staff gave me a few tips to help me round Istanbul etc.The rooms were quite pleasent to stay in the food was nice and the night reception staff Benjamin was very helpful and very nice.I would come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Spa Center / Hamam”
Reviews.Author: jma1445
Reviews.Content: This review is for the Spa Center only. We visited the Ambassador Spa Center at the recommendation of the Lonely Planet guide book. My husband was very nervous about going to a traditional Hamam because he had never had a massage before. So, we thought the Ambassador's private Hamam would be a good compromise. We had a WONDERFUL experience. There is absolutely nothing in the world like a Turkish Bath! Zeki is their masseur and he is a true professional massage therapist. The Turkish Bath and Oil Massage combo was a good value at 60 Euro. My husband and I were able to share the private Hamam together. I am dreaming of going back to visit the Spa Center soon! Note: This place is hard to find because it is tucked away in a back street of the main drag in Sultanamet. We had to ask several people where it was! We didn't stay at this hotel, but it looked like a really classy place to stay

Reviews.Title: “it very excellent hotel to enjoy stay that hotel”
Reviews.Author: brunettebrowneyes
Reviews.Content: enjoy most beautiful view city on terrace while u have meal best in night time make u feel very relaxing and very comfortable to stay there staff very friendly and excellent attiude there have massage everything u want head to toe and sauna/turkish bath it very relax massage make u feel not want do anything very chill that hotel make me so feel relaxing and comfortable very excellent hotel and very clean also there ve 24 hrs room service and reception

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with fantastic location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mancunian_on_tour
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my wife at the end of September. As we were only there for a few days location was important and we wanted to be close to all the sights. The Ambassador hotel cannot be beaten on this front as it is 2 minute walk to Blue Mosque and all major sights. Hotel is tucked away on a charming narrow street in the old town (no cars, pedestrian street only so very quiet), but just round the corner is the Sultanahmet tram stop so easy and very cheap to get around. The roof top terrace and restaurant is amazing and having breakfast looking out over the Blue Mosque and beyond to the Bhosphorus was a highlight of our stay. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Bunyamin who works the night shift was simply brilliant and gave all sorts of useful tips and advise. Erhan who works on the day shift is a fountain of knowledge. The rooms are basic and functional. Air con works well and the bathroom was nice and clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel as it provides fantastic value and the loaction cannot be beaten. Yes you do hear the early morning call to prayer from the mosque next door, but It sounds beautiful and is part of the Istanbul experience! Would defo stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay with superb service!!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSpitfire
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at The Ambassador Hotel in Istanbul and would recommend it to anyone that is going there. Eran, the front desk clerk, was the perfect gentleman and got me taken care of without delay. He was very helpful when I asked abut the area and was fluent in English, which was a huge plus! The hotel is located in the perfect spot for shopping or sight seeing.. There is a very nice restaurant on the roof, which I highly recommend also. This is a hotel that I will definitely be staying at again in the near future!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff , Killer Rooftop Terrace & Great Hamam Make this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel311
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location with all the major sites very close. The best part of our stay here was the staff. Erhan, Benjamin, Cisjin, Oor and others all made us feel very welcome and became good friends during our stay. They gave us good tips on restaurants, tours and any information we needed. They are alot of fun! The hotel manager was also very accommodating. The rooftop terrace was absolutely beautiful and we really enjoyed breakfast overlooking the Bosphorous, Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. It is also really nice to watch the sunset and hear the call to worship. Also...the hammam here is the best! It is private and Mr. Zeki is awesome and very professional. We actually switched to this hotel from another one after having the turkish bath, meeting Erhan and seeing the beautiful rooftop terrace at night! The rooms are a little dated but clean and nice. Overall an excellent choice! Thanks y'all from Louisiana

Reviews.Title: “Great place for ladies to stay”
Reviews.Author: mickey_cruisin
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty cool place for female travellers alone or with a group. I love the proximity of this hotel to the top tourist attractions like the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Topkapi Palace and other interesting places in the Sultanahmet. The Grand Bazaar is only a ten minute walk away. The tram stop just two minutes from the hotel. On the other hand the hotel has its own roof top restaurant that allows beautiful and picturesque views of the city. This is an amazing place if you just want to relax with some apple tea. The food at the is pretty mediocre but you still have several restaurants within walking distance that allow a better choice of delicious Turkish meals. The rooms are small and a bit old but still charming. Other fantastic amenities of this hotel include a spa centre for a relaxing bath, free internet access, concierge desk for tour planning, shuttle service for the airport and laundry service. Benjamin, the evening front desk attendant was absolutely wonderful and very customer service oriented; very knowledgeable and helpful when it came to giving us information on the city and other places to visit like Taksim on the Asian side. Istanbul is a quite complex city so itâ€™s always good to be shown the way by an expert. Thumbs up for Benjamin! As two young females traveling to the city we felt safe and relaxed at the Ambassador and would highly recommend it to other women planning a trip to Istanbul. I will definitely stay at the Ambassador on my next holiday to Istanbul. Thanks you guys!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Great Location Great Friendliness”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghArt
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Ambassador five times now in the past 4 years. It is in the heart of sultanhamet the best part of Istanbul and with tram connection to Taxim area. The rooms are very clean and lets say functional withn free internet, but the best thing is the friendliness of the staff which provides a lovely reliable atmosphere. The restaurant has a wonderful view of the blue mosque and breakfast is a delight. The numerous restaurants and shops around the area ensure the local atmosphere is true Turkey. I stayed once with a group of ten colleagues and everyone felt the personal warm attention that the whole team of staff provide, quite naturally. Thank you to this gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location poor quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gevic
Reviews.Content: Let me say first, the staff were excellent and the location to all sights could not be better. transport in Istanbul is excellent. The Hotel is located up an alley off a side street. The reception is acceptable with settee chairs and a computer with internet connection. Intially we were booked into a double room, which was quite small, with a double bed, wardrobe but no dressing table. The furniture was dark oak about 20 years old. I asked to be upgraded to a junior suite which I did. The only difference was a two seater settee and a jacuzzi that did not work, however we did get a small dressing table. The curtains were dirty as was the aged carpet. The bed was hard and each morning I woke with back ache. The only view was to an old building 3 metres away on whch were cooing pidgeons. The room in all honesty felt like a prison. The air conditioning was rubbish. The room service was not acceptable we had to ask for a change of towels each day, some of the towels we were given were ripped. the bed was not made up. Meals were on an upstairs terrace, the views were great, the food acceptable. However the inside dining room was sparse and old looking. The Hotel in some ways spoilt our holiday in Istanbul, however this was our first visit and I can not compare it with any other hotel. All I can comment on is what we saw and our own personel standards.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Darkskymoon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for only a couple of nights before heading south to Antalia. It was a super experience. Besides the location, which is truly fantastic, the rooftop breakfast room where you might expect to see a flying carpet go by and it wouldn't be a surprise, and the comfortable rooms with everything you can expect at that level, I have to refer the incredible politeness, helpfulness and niceness of the staff. Being a woman travelling alone in the middle east I'm always a bit on guard but here I had quite a surprise. The staff, specially at the reception, were incredibly helpful, gave me precious tips on how to move around and made me feel, in every possible way, just like at home. A very good stay that I wish to repeat in the future!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in the very heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: adda01
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel for many reasons. They have very good staff who speak good English and will help you with anything that you need. The rooms are clean and the included breakfast is really tasty. One thing that this hotel has over many others is the incredible view from the terrace on the top floor where you can have your dinner looking over at Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, so the hotel is located close to the main attractions in Istanbul and at a very reasonable price! I really recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a nice hotel in the perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “the temperature in the room was so hot that we had to walk around with only our underwears on”
Reviews.Author: syedabah
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the location. Eventhough the building was quite old it was acceptable. The breakfast up on the roof was so interesting as if we could touch the dome and the minarets of the Blue Mosque. However, we couldn't stand the heat...the temperature in the room. We had to put the aircondition temperature at the lowest and blew the fan at the maximum. We could hardly sleep as it was stuffy...and guess what? we sweat till the bed became wet!!

Reviews.Title: “it is a fabulous place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: gerbabe
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the ambassador hotel i would recommend it to anybody i love turkey and travel there a lot.i found this to be one of the best hotel's i ever stayed in the staff were brilliant and very very helpful especially benjamin the night receptionist he was lovely and so sweet there was a magnificent view from the terrace and we truly enjoyed our stay there anyone thinking of going there dont hesitate book it you will have a great time thank's to all the staff xxx hope to see you again geraldine ...

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: miss_c_mclean
Reviews.Content: Ive just got back from istanbul and have stayed in many hotels over there in the past few years and i have to say this hotel is by far the best hotel i have been to there its in a great location its 5mins away from everythin, Its terrace restaurant has fabulous views over the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome and Aya Sofya Museum, Topkapi Palace and the Bosphorus the views are amazing its in the perfect place for plenty of site seeing in this beautiful ancient city. The staff were very helpful expecially the kÄ±nd nÄ±ght rceptÄ±on benjamin, he helped me and my friends out so much so for that we thank him loads he was a gem he made our holiday. The hotel also provides a wonderful gym, massage parlour,spa with sauna and even turkish baths so if you just want to chill you can it was great being pampared. The rooms are very elegant an lovely they have wireless conection for anyone who needs the internet like a couple of my friends did due to there jobs, i would recommend this hotel to anyone and we have re-booked for september i cant wait this time there will be more of us for 3weeks of no work an just site seeing, we cant wait....

Reviews.Title: “Erhan the receptionist was great”
Reviews.Author: triptonic
Reviews.Content: i stayed in Ambassador Hotel last week. Eveything was good, had no problems, especially the cute guy at the reception made my whole stay much more fun. He was really helpful. His name is Erhan and i would like to thank him for all his help during my stay... I would recommend everyone to stay at this wonderful hotel at the heart of beautiful istanbul....

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vieques52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a marvelous week in this beautiful hotel. The hotel offered excellent accommodations and the view we enjoyed while eating our meal in the hotel restaurant was spectacular. Just a few short minutes from the hotel we were able to see the Blue Mosque, simply beautiful. We also spent a fabulous day at the Grand Bazaar shopping. It was our first trip to this historical city and we didn't know exactly where we should go, but a very helpful man at the front desk, was very pleasant and extremely informative, giving us plent of tips on where we should go. If I recall correctly his name was Ben. All the staff was exceptional curteous and well-versed on the city. I would highly recommend anyone staying at this hotel. The fitness center was also a plus for us as we are trying to stay fit. We also enjoyed a massage, now that was the highlight of our stay. All in all it is a great value and we are sure to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In An Amazing Location.”
Reviews.Author: R_Lynch
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Ambassador hotel in Istanbul. I cannot speak highly enough about the staff or the facilities on offer. Staff were very friendly and extremely helpfull and couldn't do enough for us, making us feel so welcome and nothing was too much trouble. The rooftop restaurant is fatastic and the view is nothing less than spectacular, offering stunning views of the Blue Mosque and beyond. The location is absolutely amazing, right the heart of the tourist district and only minutes away from all major attractions. I would definately reccommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul. It offers value for money, cleanliness, excellent friendly staff, great facilities all in a fantastic location that is hard to beat!!! I will definately be returning in the future and look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than a prison”
Reviews.Author: Harry2747
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the central location in Sultanahmet. While the facilties are dilapidated, the hotel staff was the worst I have encountered. They were rude, disrespectful and insulting. I had to hold some business meetings and my Turkish counterparts were systematically questioned (in Turkish so I couldn't understand) as to the purpose of their presence in the hotel. They were so insulted we had to meet elsewhere and I changed hotels the next day. Even in the former Soviet Union, such control was not exercised in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Dan011
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on here and were extremely disappointed when we actually stayed here. The hotel has tiny, cramped rooms which are full of old, worn and tired looking furniture. The bathrooms are very small. The TV in the room did not work. The room was always hot and stuffy and the air conditionining could not be regulated in the room. The internet connection in the hotel never worked the entire duration of our stay. The staff were rude and disinterested. We would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality at a budget”
Reviews.Author: bharig
Reviews.Content: A genuine review written by an American on a group trip - the Ambassador was very willing to accommodate our group at various junctions where people switched out or changed reservations while remaining polite. When some of us returned late in the night "chatty" (Check out the Sah Bar around the corner - excellent owner/employees), they were very polite about requests of being quieter. Roof prices are a bit much and the breakfast gets cold rapidly but with its location and pricing, it is a definite for groups or just individuals trying to save a bit of money and wanting to stay somewhere on par with a Holiday Inn, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: nomadEurope
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the old part of Istanbul, well within reach of the main attractions. We spent 3 days and received a very nice welcome. The breakfast is excellent with an excellent view of the Grand Mosque. Very good for a first stay. The only drawback is the "wakeup" call from the mosque nearby at 05:00.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: Bobbin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November and had a brilliant time. The location of the hotel is perfect - right in the heart of the Sultanhamet area. Just step outside and the Blue Mosque & Haghia Sofia are on your doorstep. The views from the little breakfast room are spectacular, especially at sunset or dawn (early return flight!) - you can see the domes of the Blue Mosque, the Haghia Sofia, Sea of Marmara and mountains beyond. You can have evening meals up there too. There are some excellent restaurants right outside the hotel. The Cafe Rumeli restaurant with its wood burning fires served excellent food, as did the other restaurant to the right of the hotel (name escapes me, red exterior - very friendly staff). Rooms were okay, a bit outdated but overall fine. Reception area was nice, all good for a 3 star property. Breakfast was good, continental style and again those lovely views. Would love to go back to Istanbul and would definitely return to this hotel. PS - try some simits (chewy bread and sesame seed rings) from a street vendor - delicious!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend in friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Volodymyr_Kiev
Reviews.Content: It was a very good weekend (3nights) in Istanbul. Location is the best! the room is big and the bed like new. Sometimes the room a little noisy (in the morning you can hear the sounds from other rooms), but not too much. Internet on lobby. TV chanels for baby. The personnel is VERY friendly and helpful. we had an early departure and they organized us early breakfast. We were very happy with this hotel. Next time will go there!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, perfect location, homely feel, would certainly go back.”
Reviews.Author: Inezy
Reviews.Content: In our party were two adults and a child of 7 and half and we could not have been made more welcome. The room was basic but clean and roomy for all three of us, and though the bed was hard for my taste, after requesting a few more pillows to make it softer, I was comfortable. The one thing I would have preferred is a room with natural light, we were in room 104 which seemed to be on the inside, so next time I visit I will ask for room on the other side. Buffet breakfast was ample and relatively varied and the views from the restaurant each morning were fabulous even on a misty day, the staff in the restaurant were very friendly. I must say the small but adequately maintained fitness room was good for my purpose and the Hammam (addtional payment required) was a very welcome luxury after a hard day's sightseeing. The staff on reception were very helpful giving us tips on places to visit etc, and I had many a chat, when I couldn't sleep as the hard rain poured down, with the night reception chap called Ergan, who was very friendly and made the evening hours pass rather too quickly. The hotel also has free internet in the foyer which helped a great deal. The location is superb, a tram stop two minutes from the hotel and lots of wonderful restaurants nearby, it is also within 5 minutes walk of three of the most famous sights, my favourite being Haghia Sofia Mosque, such a fabulous building and well worth spending a good 2-3 hours there. I had a terrific time in this wonderful city and would defiinitely stay at the Ambassador again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and great value, a home from home”
Reviews.Author: Caltaj
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed a very nice stay with my son and my friend, his godmother. Very warmly welcomed by all the staff, who were very helpful, recommending more off-the-tourist track places to go too. We had a large, if basic room, but comfortable and plenty of space for 3 of us. Ample breakfast buffet, and ideal location right near the sights, and a stone's throw from some great restaurants. The hammam was also a relaxing treat!

Reviews.Title: “Position super”
Reviews.Author: BodrumLady
Reviews.Content: Great position - very near all main attractions. Rooms very dated and even though I paid extra for the jacuzzi room I found it very basic and ordinary. There were no tea making things in the room but the service from reception was excellent and they brought us tea by room service. Erdel on reception was charming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lizicat
Reviews.Content: The Ambassador Hotel is a short walk away from the Sultanahmet Tramway stop. The hotel is set back from the street a bit, and is very quiet. No need to take a taxi if you can make it onto the Tramway. Everyone working there was very nice and friendly. We had some issues with a clogged shower and they attempted to fix it right away. We had a double room, which was huge and clean. Beds were very comfortable. Internet was free and they have a computer available in the lobby if you didn't bring yours. No view from the room, but the view from the breakfast patio was fantastic. Breakfast here is excellent...great coffee, Turkish tea, lots of selection that changes daily. The place has a really comfortable atmosphere. The TV includes lots of movie channels in English (but you will likely need help trying to figure out how the remote works). Location is perfect, can take the tramway to the major sites or walk a few minutes to the mosques and attractions. We recommend the restaurant Bodrum, which is near the Cistern. The hotel next to 2 very romantic restaurants, which we didn't try, but looked nice. Can't go wrong with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we'd stayed longer at the Ambassador!”
Reviews.Author: alliswell252
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Istanbul a day early and the Hotel Nomade arranged for us to stay at the Ambassador. Our one night there was just terrific and we wish we'd booked our entire stay there. It is conveniently located in Sultanahmet but set back a bit and very quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful and the room was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure!”
Reviews.Author: CairoKudra
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of its proximity to the best locations in Sultan Ahmet, and also because it has its own in-house spa facilities! No need to walk or take a taxi to a turkish bath -- you can book a bath and a massage with the reception a few hours in advance anytime during your stay -- and it is truly marvelous.... the massage therapist is great; very conscientious, quiet and gifted. The rooms are clean, spacious, good t.v. great bathroom, and the breakfast is served on a lovely indoor/outdoor roof terrace with a view of the Blue Mosque only a few hundred meters away. But most of all, I recommend this hotel for its extremely warm, and courteous staff, who went out of their way to make me feel welcome. Noray and Ayhan, who work mornings and afternoons, and Ergin who's on the night-shift, are all genuinely friendly people, ready to help out in any situation.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: bevbozkurt
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night break at this wonderful little hotel in the best city in the world. I have stayed at other hotels in Istanbul, but i can honestly say this was the nicest and the friendliest. We chose the junior suite, perfectly positioned just beside the lift and the stairs for the roof terrace and breakfast. The breath taking views are out of this world. Breakfast was wonderful with a vast selection to suit everyone and Sesgin was a truly helpful friendly guy with perfect english. I cant think of a bad thing to say about anything, so if you are looking for a friendly little hotel in the centre of Sultanahmet, you couldnt do any better than book at the Ambassador. Thanx to all the wonderful staff who made our stay so special. Bev and Huseyin

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DubrovnikCroatia
Reviews.Content: We just came back home (November 2008). We spent 5 unforgetable days at the Ambassador Hotel. This is fantastic little hotel located in a quiet street in the heart of Sultanahmet . It is located only a few minutes walk from Agia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, shoping center, restaurants, caffe shops...... It was excellent just what we needed. The staff is unbelievably helpful and friendly. They will help you with any aspect of your stay . The breakfast in the hotel is excellent. There is a large buffet and very nice, very tasty food. The breakfast is served on the top floor and you get excellent views of the old part of the city. We enjoyed sitting on the terrace. Here you will feel just like if you were staying with your own family. They are very nice, very kind, the rooms are clean. I definitely recommend this place as a perfect option for Istanbul. Thanks to everyone! We will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SacramentoFred
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have traveled on virtually all continents and in many of the worlds great cities. Based on recomendation of a friend, we spent a week at the Ambassador. Particularly for the price, it was one of the best hotels we have experienced. Not only was the location supurb, but the room was clean and well cared for, the staff very friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet on the rooftop overlooking the city was very generous. All staff of this little hotel went out of their way to see that our needs were met. It is recommeded without qualification. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: nanawee
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel 20 plus times over the last 10 years and wouldn't think of staying any other place. The staff is wonderful, the rooms are always clean, the free breakfast is plentiful and very good. The location is just minutes walking distance from most attractions and if you want to take the tram, it's just a few steps away. This trip I was greeted by a new receptionst, Ergin who was friendly and a perfect fit for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: worldmusician
Reviews.Content: The Ambassador Hotel sits in the middle of the Sultanhamet neighborhood of Istanbul and serves as the perfect spot to stage your visit to Istanbul. The Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Roman Cistern, and more restaurants than you can count are just steps away. Transportation is not necessary to get to the historic points of Istanbul. Even the Grand Bazaar and Spice Market are within a fifteen minute walk without breaking a sweat. For location, this hotel cannot be beat. The accommodations were comfortable. It is by no means the Intercontinental, but the rooms sufficed, though being small (we stayed in the standard rooms). The showers were tight, but that is typical of small boutique hotels that I have stayed in during my travels. The breakfast in the morning was not be beat. It is in the restaurant/terrace on the 5th floor overlooking the Blue Mosque. The selections included traditional buffet faire such as eggs and breads to more traditional Turkish foods including olives and various vegetables. The staff throughout our stay was very warm and helpful in suggesting itineraries, helping find great restaurants (be aware that they will of course suggest their restaurant on the roof for dinner), and arranging for transportation as needed. Through their website, we were able to arrange for transportation to and from the airport (free on the way in and for a reasonable price on the way out). After riding with a few other taxis along the way, I can highly endorse their driver who was quick but safe unlike others we caught along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location - greath staff”
Reviews.Author: emerald11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in April 2007. Perfectly located - some good restaurants near by, close to tram stop and all sights in old Istanbul. View from terrace amazing - best at night - nice place to sit and have a final drink before bed. Hotel staff were very knowledgeable and booked a fish restaurant for us under the Galata Bridge - a taxi collected us and returned us. Walking distance to Blue Mosque, Cisterns, Haghia Sophia and Grand Bazaar. Can't wait to go back again at Easter 2008. Would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Welcoming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rufus88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located to all the major sights in Sultanahmet. The staff were extremely helpful in advising on the best travel routes for trips further afield. The hotel may not be as modern as a Hilton but the hotel offers a much more personal experience. The hotel is very clean and offers a great choice of dishes for breakfast. The view from the roof terrace is spectacular. If you fancy trying a turkish bath I would recommend using the hotel service which also offers a full oil massage. We tried another local hammam in the area but the hotel was by far and away the best offering an unhurried service from a professional masseuse. Our only regret is that we did not try the hotel service earlier during our stay ! We would most definitely stay at the Ambassador again if visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Exotic”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumDE
Reviews.Content: The Ambassador Hotel proved to be a welcome respite from the large, anonymous American-style hotels which many tourists choose when overseas. The location is phenomenal, with an amazing terrace view of both the Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque. The staff, especially Nuray and Melanie, could not have been nicer, speaking perfect English and offering many suggestions for sights and nearby restaurants. The Hammam, located on the premises, is beautiful-- the Turkish massage for only 30 euros--a once in a lifetime experience! The massage alone is worth a repeat stay. Wonderful restaurants line the small street outside, and don't miss the Ancient Cistern, only 2 blocks away. Although the room was very basic, it was large and clean. The exotic buffet breakfast is lovely--very authentically Turkish-- on the terrace, with the afore-mentioned awesome views. Would I stay here again? Yes, without hesitation!!

Reviews.Title: “Ambassador-great location”
Reviews.Author: brubrew
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Ambassador. They had a package that entailed picking me up and returning me to the airport and two days of guided tours. It was convenient to everything in the historical district. I really enjoyed my experience and would recommend this trip to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing New Year's Trip in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Cskopje
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ambassador Hotel back in December 2006-January 2007. We were met at the airport by our hotel-organized transfer promptly. Check-in was friendly and helpful. The rooms looked exactly as they do in the Hotel Photos, and we got quite attatched to them. The beds were always clean and comfortable. The bathroom was average-small sized and usually clean, just a little bit of mold on the ceiling. The TV had cable. We were also really impressed by the fact that every room had wireless internet. The tours booked at the front desk were great. Also, the front desk sent us across the street to the Mozaik Restaraunt which was FANTASTIC! The front desk staff always helped us with recommendations, bookings, and planning. The staff really made the stay for us! The room on the top of the hotel was amazing! You could see all of Sultanhemet Square and the views were amazing all day. The breakfast was fine, with lots of selection. We had a great time in Istanbul. There were lots of celebrations for New Year everywhere. It really was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: NewZealandRusty
Reviews.Content: Our 4-day package included airport pick up and drop off, 2 full day tours including lunches and a full body massage each. Staff friendly and helpful, room very adequate size with very good facilities; Breakfast on rooftop with view to die for. Hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: Londoner27
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Ambassador in the first week of the New Year, in a junior suite. We chose the Ambassador because we were keen to stay in the Sultanahmet, there weren't any nice rooms in more popular hotels like the Empress Zoe, the Ambassador seemed to offer a good price for a suite and there was a deal that was supposed to include free airport transfers and a free massage. The location was convenient and the hotel lobby seemed attractive but the room itself looked very shabby. And it's not a 'suite', just a large-ish room with a fairly small bathroom that has no freestanding shower and a rather tired-looking whirlpool bath. We asked to see another room but it looked even worse, so we decided to stay put. The staff were courteous but none of them was particularly helpful and the receptionist seemed more concerned about plugging specific trips and restaurants to his guests than about addressing the fact that a light in the bedroom didn't work. The view from the breakfast terrace is beautiful and the breakfast itself was OK (fruit preserves, yoghurt, no real fresh fruit juice, not the greatest bread and pastries). But when I return to Istanbul, I plan either to find somewhere modern and clean near Taksim Square/Beyoglu or to try a more upmarket Sultanahmet location. Oh yes, and we never received the free massage. Instead, we got given a price list on arrival.

HotelInfo.Name: Ambassador Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Divanyolu Ticarethane Sokak No: 19, Istanbul 34420, Turkey
